Posts.Content: J45 wrote: I am positively terrified.  I skipped one year on my mammograms - I'm 45 with no previous problems - Now they've found a lump which when viewed with ultrasound has the bad edges ruling out a cyst - under my armpits there are swollen glands - having needle biopsy next week and then the dreaded wait for results which will include another long weekend - radiologist was not the least bit reassuring. The mass is about 7mm, which I thought meant small, but once they said the armpit glands were swollen, I lost all hope of it being small and contained inside just the breast :( I am so afraid to leave my child motherless - it's all I can think about. Sorry to be so morbid. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: on verge of diagnosis J45 Mindyandgang

Posts.Content: Sep 1, 2012 10:30AM J45 wrote: thank you lou 10 :)  I can't believe how sweet you all are when I am just a stranger - what a wonderful group you all are :)
Posts.Title: on verge of diagnosis J45 Mindyandgang

Posts.Content: Sep 5, 2012 03:00PM J45 wrote: Tomorrow is my biopsy. I realize it's ridiculous that I haven't even been diagnosed yet, and I'm this scared, but this armpit node thing has made me feel so hopeless. I can't imagine why else I'd have the swollen nodes otherwise. I can now easily find/feel the swollen, sore lymph nodes in my armpit. I have been trying to reassure myself that people survive this, even when it's spread to the lymph nodes . . . but it seems like everybody you hear about, celebrities, friends, etc. always say, "they caught mine early - before it spread to my lymph nodes". That feels so discouraging. I am such a baby.
Posts.Title: on verge of diagnosis J45 Mindyandgang

Posts.Content: Sep 5, 2012 04:07PM J45 wrote: Thanks ZBA - I have noticed how everyone here says stay off Google - apparently it doesn't help us and just freaks us out, eh? I'm so glad to know that - it's such an easy thing to try and figure out all we can online only to end up more upset than ever. I will be praying for an excellent test result for you. Our minds are just a terrible enemy sometimes when we have to wait. I was amazed the other day when I mentioned my anxiety about the test results to the radiologist - she misunderstood and thought I was terrified of the upcoming biopsy itself. I had to tell her that the actual procedure didn't frighten me - just fearing what she'd find. It was odd - as though she didn't already know that. You would think she would be accustomed to the dread people have awaiting results.
Posts.Title: on verge of diagnosis J45 Mindyandgang

Posts.Content: Sep 1, 2012 09:38AM J45 wrote: thank you infobabe :)
Posts.Title: on verge of diagnosis J45 Mindyandgang

Posts.Content: Sep 1, 2012 09:05AM J45 wrote: thank you morningperson - it does help - As silly as it sounds, it's always been my coping mechanism to explore the worst case scenario of things - like I can prepare myself for the worst, then be relieved when it's not that bad -when I try being optimistic, it seems to shock my system so much more when news is bad - I had worked myself up with all these positive outcomes when they called saying I needed a second mammogram - I tried to think it was just a cyst, a shadow, etc. - then I get angry/shocked when I am told it's not - it's all about me trying to see the future which is not possible of course. I am praying for you to have excellent results - and thanks again.
Posts.Title: on verge of diagnosis J45 Mindyandgang

Posts.Content: Sep 1, 2012 11:02AM J45 wrote: Mkelley30 - thanks for the input and excellent advice - my mind is often my worst enemy!
Posts.Title: on verge of diagnosis J45 Mindyandgang

Posts.Content: Sep 5, 2012 03:49PM J45 wrote: Thanks Diane :)  I always do borrow trouble - it's my coping strategy strangely enough - assuming the worst as opposed to being blindsided by bad news or something. My husband's 1st wife died of breast cancer about 19 years ago. I must remember that she had the lump for a long time before they truly tested and determined it was cancer . . . and then it was very large and had spread . . . So many advancements have taken place since then - My prayer is that God would not make him go through this again with another wife.  I got some Xanax from my doc, but strangely it only seems to make me a bit drowsy - doesn't seem to help the anxiety. Perhaps I have such strong anxiety that no pill can beat it lol! I can't put into words how amazing it is to have you gals on here . . . it's like you are the only ones who get the real panic, terror, sadness. . . and it's like you are all old friends I've known forever. My fat kitty has climbed up into my face now - she thinks biting me on the nose is therapeutic for some reason.
Posts.Title: on verge of diagnosis J45 Mindyandgang

Posts.Content: Sep 5, 2012 04:14PM J45 wrote: Thank you Claire :)  Yes, the leaving your child part is so frightening. I had a dream that my husband, son and I were traveling through a large theme park - I believe the park was representative of our journey through life in general - anyway they went ahead of me through a glass door which locked behind them - I couldn't get the door open and was knocking, but they didn't see me and went on their way, leaving me behind. I think it was like an analogy to how these battles are ours alone to fight even though others are there with us. I have to remember I am not alone. Everyone on here is fighting alongside each other :) When I come on here, I don't feel so alone anymore.
Posts.Title: on verge of diagnosis J45 Mindyandgang
